health_page.cta_content: Contribute to groundbreaking research that transforms healthcare systems across Africa.
health_page.title: Health
health_page.intro: Health is a human right that requires a complete state of physical, mental, and social well-being, and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.
health_page.collaboration: We collaborate with governments, international organizations, and health sector leaders to make healthcare more accessible.

gabon_health_system.title: Gabonese health system: a 20-year analysis
gabon_health_system.content: In response to the high prevalence of HIV/AIDS and malaria, the Gabonese government launched the National Social Insurance and Social Protection Fund in 2008. This is a national health insurance voted by Parliament to extend health coverage to different socio-economic groups in the country, bringing everyone under one social health insurance umbrella. However, out-of-pocket expenditures (21.87%) as a percentage of total health expenditures remain higher than other sub-Saharan African countries classified as upper-middle-income countries.

sexual_harassment.title: School Harassment Study 2023
sexual_harassment.content: The Biangg research firm has already collected nearly 3000 data points on sexual harassment and mental health in schools across Africa. Only 2.85% of victims reported it and only 18.11% of institutions have a policy against sexual harassment. Our studies in Gabon, Rwanda, and Chad show a high prevalence with over 21% of students thinking it would be better to die or considering harming themselves in some way. Our goal is to support policymakers with evidence-based data to help them create an enriching environment for students.
sexual_harassment.support: You can support the continuation of this study by donating here

socioeconomic_status.title: Socioeconomic Status & Perinatal Depression
socioeconomic_status.content: Socioeconomic status measures a person's or family's social position based on income, education, and occupation. Inequalities in socioeconomic status are increasing. Our preliminary results show a link between perinatal depression (70%), physical violence against women during pregnancy (8%), suicidal thoughts (13%), cigarette use during pregnancy (28%), and mortality rates.
socioeconomic_status.support: You can support the continuation of this study by donating here

nutrition_page.title: Public Health Nutrition
nutrition_page.food_security_description: To guarantee food security, you need permanent access to adequate quantities of nutritious and healthy food, allowing you to lead a healthy and active life.
nutrition_page.cta_content: With 1 in 11 people worldwide facing hunger in 2023, and 1 in 5 in Africa (WHO), Biangg offers research tools and policies to reduce food insecurity. We've also designed a weight loss program to prevent cardiovascular diseases.

women_migrants.title: Overview of migrant women's health in South Korea: policy recommendations
women_migrants.content: In response to the high prevalence of HIV/AIDS and malaria, the Gabonese government launched the National Social Insurance and Social Protection Fund in 2008. This is a national health insurance voted by Parliament to extend health coverage to different socio-economic groups in the country, bringing everyone under one social health insurance umbrella. However, out-of-pocket expenditures (21.87%) as a percentage of total health expenditures remain higher than other sub-Saharan African countries classified as upper-middle-income countries.

foreign_students.title: Dietary Acculturation of Foreign Students in Daegu
foreign_students.content: The Biangg research firm has already collected nearly 3000 data points on sexual harassment and mental health in schools across Africa. Only 2.85% of victims reported it and only 18.11% of institutions have a policy against sexual harassment. Our studies in Gabon, Rwanda, and Chad show a high prevalence with over 21% of students thinking it would be better to die or considering harming themselves in some way. Our goal is to support policymakers with evidence-based data to help them create an enriching environment for students.
foreign_students.support: You can support the continuation of this study by donating here

dental_health.title: Presence of dental caries is associated with mothers' education level among Korean children and adolescents
dental_health.content: Dental caries remains one of the most common chronic diseases affecting children worldwide with multifactorial etiology. The study evaluated the association between socioeconomic status (SES), dietary intake, food insecurity (FI), and dental caries in Korean children and adolescents. The study used data from the Korean National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (KNHANES), conducted over 2 years with 1,559 boys and 1,391 Korean girls aged 2 to 18 years from 2012 to 2013. Fathers' education level (P = 0.017), mothers' education level (P < 0.001), and household income (P = 0.049) were all significantly associated with dental caries in Korean boys.

education_page.title: Education
education_page.intro: Education can change a person's socioeconomic status and that of their family while contributing to their physical, mental and social well-being.
education_page.description: Our research aims to improve learning models and academic content while reducing educational inequalities.
education_page.cta_content: Contact us to discuss your research needs in education and learning models.

dental_study.title: Presence of dental caries is associated with mothers' education level among Korean children and adolescents
dental_study.content: Dental caries remains one of the most common chronic diseases affecting children worldwide with multifactorial etiology. The study evaluated the association between socioeconomic status (SES), dietary intake, food insecurity (FI), and dental caries in Korean children and adolescents. The study used data from the Korean National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (KNHANES), conducted over 2 years with 1,559 boys and 1,391 Korean girls aged 2 to 18 years from 2012 to 2013.
dental_study.image_alt: Mother and son dental health study

harassment_study.title: School Harassment Study 2023 in schools
harassment_study.content: The Biangg research firm has already collected nearly 3000 data points on sexual harassment and mental health in schools across Africa. Only 2.85% of victims reported it and only 18.11% of institutions have a policy against sexual harassment. Our studies in Gabon, Rwanda, and Chad show a high prevalence with over 21% of students thinking it would be better to die or considering harming themselves in some way.
harassment_study.support: You can support the continuation of this study by donating here

violence_study.title: Women's education level is associated with domestic violence
violence_study.content: Socioeconomic status measures a person's or family's social position based on income, education, and occupation. Our preliminary results show that women victims of domestic violence during pregnancy (8%) did not have a university education and did not have paying jobs.
violence_study.support: You can support the continuation of this study by donating here

public_page.title: Public Sector
public_page.intro: Community engagement facilitates the resolution of societal problems and creates mutually beneficial relationships.
public_page.description: Biangg assists you in solving complex social problems through community engagement, research and training.
public_page.impact_title: Our Impact in the Public Sector
public_page.cta_title: Do you have a public sector project?
public_page.cta_content: Contact us to discuss your research and community engagement needs.

voting_study.title: To vote or not to vote: how to increase citizen participation
voting_study.content: In this study, we examined the reasons for or against citizen participation in voting. We identified 6 variables of interest associated with citizen participation in voting: civic duty, uncertainty of results, voting habit, age, political interest and resource availability.

alcohol_study.title: Alcoholism, addiction and risky behavior
alcohol_study.content: Alcoholism kills approximately 3 million people per year, or 5.3% globally. This study conducted in Libreville with 554 participants shows that the age category of 40 years and older is at risk of developing alcohol dependence, that alcohol consumption is linked to socioeconomic status, and that men are twice as likely to develop dependence.

teachers_study.title: Length of residence is associated with cardiovascular disease risk factors among foreign English teachers in Korea
teachers_study.content: This study examined the association between acculturation and CVD risk factors among English teachers from Europe and the United States living in Korea. Results show that length of residence in Korea was associated with hypertension, BMI and physical inactivity, with less favorable risk profiles among those living in Korea for more than five years.

harcelement.title: School Harassment Study 2023 in African Schools
harcelement.description: We are currently conducting the largest study ever on the prevalence of sexual harassment in schools in certain African countries.
harcelement.action_text: Participate in the study by selecting the country where you reside
harcelement.support_text: Thank you for supporting us financially

depression.title: Socio-Economic Status & Perinatal Depression
depression.description: We need your help to propose solutions that will contribute to the well-being of pregnant women and those suffering from postpartum depression in Africa. Our preliminary data already shows the relationship between women's social status, healthcare service utilization, and voluntary homicide due to perinatal depression.

alcool.title: Alcohol Consumption and Injury Risks
alcool.description: We request about two minutes of your time for this global study on alcohol consumption and physical, material, health, and psychological harm to better educate populations and governments on this social issue. Your participation is anonymous. No personal information will be recorded.
alcool.action_text: To participate in this study, click here

values.title: Our Shared Values
values.description1: At Biangg, shared values enable us to provide solutions to complex social problems through community engagement, research, and training.
values.description2: Creating shared value addresses societal needs and challenges with a business model. It goes beyond philanthropy or corporate social responsibility. This business approach contributes to the well-being of our shareholders, society, and the planet.

about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: Our Commitment to Excellence
about.description1: Biangg is a research firm that helps governments and institutions thrive in a dynamic market by providing solutions to complex social problems through community engagement, research, and training.
about.description2: Our interdisciplinary approach combines expertise in public health, social sciences, and data analysis to create measurable impacts.

aboutPage.title: Who We Are
aboutPage.intro: Biangg is a consulting firm specializing in the analysis of socio-economic statistical data, management, and the implementation of policies aimed at well-being and reducing social inequalities.

services.title: Our Services
services.description: We strengthen your data-driven decision-making by providing expert consulting services. We specialize in delivering customized solutions that match your unique needs. Our goal is to provide you with the insights and advice necessary to achieve your objectives and stay ahead in today's competitive landscape.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.content: To reduce social disparities and create a state of physical, psychological, and social well-being for populations.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To improve your decision-making through research, community engagement, and education.

values.title: Our Values
values.description: With people at the heart of everything we do, our values guide every decision in service to our clients.

team.title: Our Team
team.subtitle: Meet the dedicated professionals behind our success

notFound.description: Don't worry, even astronauts get lost sometimes. Let's get you back on track!

research_participation.question: How can I participate in your current research studies?
research_participation.answer: You can participate by selecting your country from the list in our 'Current Projects' section. If your country isn't listed, please contact us at global@biangg.ca to express your interest in participating.

study_confidentiality.question: Is my participation in the studies confidential?
study_confidentiality.answer: Yes, all participant data is anonymized. We don't collect personal identifiers, and your responses remain strictly confidential according to international research ethics standards.

research_funding.question: How can I support your research financially?
research_funding.answer: We welcome donations through our secure online platform. Your support helps us expand our research to more countries and communities. Visit our donation page or contact us for more information.

service_consultation.question: What does the free 45-minute consultation include?
service_consultation.answer: Our consultation provides an initial assessment of your needs, whether for research, data analysis, or strategic planning. We'll discuss potential solutions and how our services can support your objectives.

country_not_listed.question: My country isn't listed in your studies. Can I still participate?
country_not_listed.answer: Absolutely. We're constantly expanding our research to new regions. Please email us at global@biangg.ca with your country information, and we'll notify you when we launch studies in your area.

data_usage.question: How do you use the research data collected?
data_usage.answer: Our data is used to: 1) Inform policy recommendations, 2) Develop community interventions, 3) Publish academic research (always anonymized), and 4) Create awareness campaigns. We never sell or share personal data.

training_programs.question: What types of training programs do you offer?
training_programs.answer: We provide: 1) On-site research methodology training, 2) Webinars on data analysis, 3) Coaching for social impact measurement, and 4) Customized training for organizations. Visit our Services section for details.

research_duration.question: How long do your research studies typically last?
research_duration.answer: Study durations vary: 1) Surveys typically take 5-15 minutes, 2) Longitudinal studies may run for 6-12 months, 3) National prevalence studies often take 1-2 years. Each project page specifies its timeline.

hero.title: 12-Week Weight Loss Program
hero.subtitle: A comprehensive program designed to help you adopt healthy eating habits and improve your physical, social, and mental well-being

programOverview.title: Program Overview
programOverview.description: This 12-week program provides essential tools for weight loss through 5 video modules in English. Each module contains 2-5 lessons ranging from 8 to 22 minutes each. You'll learn practical skills like reading nutrition labels and determining your body's water needs. You can purchase all 5 modules for optimal results or just the ones that interest you.
programOverview.tools: The program comes with measurement tools including a scale, BMI calculator, jump rope, blood pressure monitor, and electronic jump rope. These tools available in our health store will help you track your progress.

list.title: Module 1: Getting Started
lessons: Unit 1.4: Health Risks Associated with Body Weight and Fat

list.title: Module 3: Nutrition Facts Label
lessons: Unit 3.3: Dietary Reference Intake vs Daily Value

list.title: Module 4: Meal Planning
lessons: Unit 4.1: Six Principles of Meal Planning
Unit 4.2: Case Study: Mediterranean vs Low-Fat Vegan Diet
